newsitem.title: ITALY: Croatia's INA plans London stock listing by 1999.
newsitem.headline: Croatia's INA plans London stock listing by 1999.

text.p: Croatia's state-owned oil and gas company INA plans a listing on the London stock exchange by 1999 when the state will sell a 25 percent stake, INA General Director Andrija Kojakovic told an energy meeting.
"We plan a London listing by the year 1999 and we are already looking at March that year," he said in an address to the Offshore Mediterranean Conference.
"The government plans to sell 25 percent of INA in 1999," he added.
The company planned to concentrate on its core activities of oil and gas exploration and production, refining and marketing after spinning off businesses like hotel and shipyard ownership last year.

"INA today in the world is drilling with partners in Libya, Egypt and Albania," Kojakovic said. INA planned investment of $500 million in the period 2000-2010 to upgrade refineries and its retail network in Croatia and neighbouring countries.
"Our strategic goal is to be an integrated international, Middle Europe, oil company quoted on the London stock exchange," he added.
